title: Roger Federer explains why he will miss Rafa Nadal's wedding to childhood sweetheart
text:

Roger Federer has confirmed he will not attend the wedding of tennis rival Rafa Nadal.

Nadal will tie the knot with childhood sweetheart Maria Francisca Perello in Majorca on Saturday.

The Spaniard's coaches Carlos Moya and Francis Roig are set to be in attendance and long-term rival Federer was asked if he would make the trip.

But speaking during the US Open, Federer confirmed he would not be there, stating: "I have other plans".

The 38-year-old is set to make his debut at the Swiss Indoors in Basel on Monday and will remain his homeland this weekend.

(Image: MARTIAL TREZZINI/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: REUTERS)

Federer and Nadal have enjoyed an incredible rivalry, facing off against each other as many as 40 times.

They famously played out an epic final at Wimbledon in 2008, a match that lasted almost five hours and is regarded by many as the greatest match ever.

The pair also locked horns earlier this year as Federer defeated the Spaniard in the semi-finals at Wimbledon.

Fans finally got to see them playing together earlier this year when the superstars joined forces for doubles action at the Laver Cup.

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Instagram)

Nadal will marry his long-term partner at La Fortaleza, where 2016 BBC spy thriller The Night Manager starring Hugh Laurie was filmed.

Juan Carlos I, King of Spain for more than four decades until his abdication in June 2014, is on the guest list of 350 people.

The couple have been dating for 14 years.

She gave up a job in insurance to become project director for the Rafa Nadal Foundation, the charity he founded nearly ten years ago.
description: Rafa Nadal will tie the knot with childhood sweetheart Maria Francisca Perello in Majorca on Saturday
